TopicTitle: Unable to set a planet as a target

Articles.Content:
I'm on my way to to Jool, and for some reason (probably a double click or something) it is no longer my ship's target.

When I left click on Jool, to set it as target again, nothing happens. I can focus my view on it if i double click, but I can't get the little menu to appear which enables me to set as target.

I can set any other planet or moon as target, just not Jool.

What am I missing? Thanks in advance

Edited June 19, 2014 by Oafman
If you single click the menu should pop up. If it doesn't try right clicking.
It gets buggy. Just keep clicking around it until you get a focus, and set your target.

You could also do quicksave and immediately load the quicksave to see if that clears up the problem. That's what I do when I find I can't click on anything (which isn't exactly what's happening but maybe it will help clear this up as well)
Have you tried clicking on the line of the planet's orbital path? That should give you the option as well.
Have you entered Jool's SOI? You cannot target a body you are orbiting

Have you entered Jool's SOI? You cannot target a body you are orbiting

Probably this. But I've also had a similar problem and restarting KSP helped.

Nah I'm only half way to Jool, not in its SoI yet. I clicked everywhere around the planet, but only ended up targeting various moons, and never the actual planet. Tried restarting, but nothing changed.

But then I clicked on my path and created a random maneuver node, and hey presto, I was immediately able to select the planet as a target. I then removed the node and the planet remained as my target. So this doesn't explain why it happened - just a bug I guess - but it was an easy fix.

Thank you all for your suggestions.
